intro: Xysmalobium vexillare, commonly known as the velvetleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to purple flowers in late spring. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
